google-flights.Description:
1. "type": Type a string via the keyboard.
2. "press": Press a key on the keyboard, including "enter", "space", "tab" .3. "click": Press click.
Specifier:

Extract the html elements containing depart, arrival, departure date and return date according to examples in following format
<input type="text"Birmingham</input>-- input element index = 0
<input type="text"Where to?</input>-- input element index = 1
<input type="text"Departure</input>-- input element index = 2
<input type="text"Return</input>-- input element index = 3
Filter the list of elements to pick departure flights. Keep the same format format for the filtered content
Filter the list of elements to pick returning flights. Keep the same format format for the filtered content
google-flights.SubtaskReformation:
Task:
Book the cheapest round trip flight from Hartford, CT to: TVC departing on 10/09/2023 and returning on 10/15/2023.
Subtasks:
1. `Type the flight from: 'Hartford, CT' to: 'TVC', 'type the departure date 10/09/2023', 'type the return date 10/15/2023', and finally 'press tab' and press 'enter'.` 
2. `Pick the cheapest departure flight from list and 'click'.` 
3. `Pick cheapest returning flight from list and 'click'.` 

Task:
Book the cheapest round trip flight from London to: Dubai departing on 11/08/2023 and returning on 11/15/2023.
Subtasks:
1. `Type the flight from: 'London' to: 'Dubai', 'type the departure date 11/08/2023', 'type the return date 11/15/2023', and finally 'press tab' and press 'enter'.` 
2. `Pick the cheapest departure flight from list and 'click'.` 
3. `Pick cheapest returning flight from list and 'click'.`

Task: 
Book the cheapest round trip flight of Saudia Airline from: Jeddah to: London departing on 17/10/2023 and returning on 27/10/2023.
Subtasks:
1.`Type the flight from: 'Jeddah' to: 'London', 'type the departure date 17/10/2023', 'type the return date 27/10/2023', and finally 'press tab' and press 'enter'.` 
2. `Pick the cheapest departure saudia airline flight (if available) and if not available pick the cheapest departure flight from list and 'click'.` 
3. `Pick the cheapest returning saudia airline flight (if available) and if not available pick cheapest returning flight from list and 'click'.`

ObsFilterPrefix: Extract the SVG out of HTML.
Extract all items in SVG out of HTML. For texts, extract fill and font-size. For polygons, extract fill and points. For circles, extract fill and r. For rectangles, extract fill, width and height.

There are five types of items in the SVG:
1. Digit (0-9). If the font size is 10px, it is a small one. If the font size if 20px, it is a large one. For example, <text font-size="10px">5</text> is small and <text font-size="20px">p</text> is large.
2. Letter (A-Z, a-z). If the font size is 10px, it is a small one. If the font size if 20px, it is a large one. For example, <text font-size="10px">5</text> is small and <text font-size="20px">p</text> is large.
3. Triangle. If the distance between the x coordinates of two pointes is 5, it is a small one. If it is 10, it is a large one. For example, <polygon points="85,95 90,85 95,95"></polygon> is small because the distance of x coordinates between two points is 5, and <polygon points="80,40 90,20 100,40"></polygon> is large because the distance of x coordinates between two points is 10.
4. Circle. If the radius is 5, it is a small one. If the radius is 10, it is a large one. For example, <circle r="5"></circle> is small and <circle r="10"></circle> is large.
5. Rectangle. If the width or height is both 10, it is a small one. If one of them is 20, it is a large one. For example, <rect width="10" height="10"></rect> is small and <rect width="20" height="20"></rect> is large.

click-shape-ablation.Description: 1. "clickxpath": Click an HTML element with a valid xpath.
ObsFilterPrefix:
Extract the SVG out of HTML. There are five types of items in the SVG:
1. Digit (0-9). If the font size is 10px, it is a small one. If the font size if 20px, it is a large one. For example, <text font-size="10px">5</text> is small and <text font-size="20px">p</text> is large.
2. Letter (A-Z, a-z). If the font size is 10px, it is a small one. If the font size if 20px, it is a large one. For example, <text font-size="10px">5</text> is small and <text font-size="20px">p</text> is large.
3. Triangle. If the distance between the x coordinates of two pointes is 5, it is a small one. If it is 10, it is a large one. For example, <polygon points="85,95 90,85 95,95"></polygon> is small because the distance of x coordinates between two points is 5, and <polygon points="80,40 90,20 100,40"></polygon> is large because the distance of x coordinates between two points is 10.
4. Circle. If the radius is 5, it is a small one. If the radius is 10, it is a large one. For example, <circle r="5"></circle> is small and <circle r="10"></circle> is large.
5. Rectangle. If the width or height is both 10, it is a small one. If one of them is 20, it is a large one. For example, <rect width="10" height="10"></rect> is small and <rect width="20" height="20"></rect> is large.
click-shape-ablation.ReformationPrefix: Select exactly one of the items that satisfy the given conditions.

Extract all items in SVG out of HTML. For texts, extract fill and font-size. For polygons, extract fill and points. For circles, extract fill and r. For rectangles, extract fill, width and height.

There are five types of items in the SVG:
1. Digit (0-9). If the font size is 10px, it is a small one. If the font size if 20px, it is a large one. For example, <text font-size="10px">5</text> is small and <text font-size="20px">p</text> is large.
2. Letter (A-Z, a-z). If the font size is 10px, it is a small one. If the font size if 20px, it is a large one. For example, <text font-size="10px">5</text> is small and <text font-size="20px">p</text> is large.
3. Triangle. If the distance between the x coordinates of two pointes is 5, it is a small one. If it is 10, it is a large one. For example, <polygon points="85,95 90,85 95,95"></polygon> is small because the distance of x coordinates between two points is 5, and <polygon points="80,40 90,20 100,40"></polygon> is large because the distance of x coordinates between two points is 10.
4. Circle. If the radius is 5, it is a small one. If the radius is 10, it is a large one. For example, <circle r="5"></circle> is small and <circle r="10"></circle> is large.
5. Rectangle. If the width or height is both 10, it is a small one. If one of them is 20, it is a large one. For example, <rect width="10" height="10"></rect> is small and <rect width="20" height="20"></rect> is large.

For replying, the format is "Reply the email from {Sender} with {Message}.". For starring (aka marking as important), the format is "Star the email from {Sender}.". For deletion, the format is "Delete the email from {Sender}.". Ignore other conditions such as "this morning", "latest", etc.
